mdRecord.dcterms:title: UVa Presidents, Honor System
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Bromley, Ann
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: The Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Article: UVa's honor system has survived for 150 years because it is student-run and each student must choose to abide by its simple core of principles, according to the four living UVa presidents who participated in the Honor 150 celebration April 2, 1992. Speaking on Institutional Integrity in Academia, Edgar F. Shannon Jr., Frank L. Hereford Jr., Robert M. O'Neil and John T. Casteen III drew from their experiences as University leaders and, in the cases of Hereford and Casteen, as students.
mdRecord.dcterms:isPartOf: The University of Virginia Visual History Collection
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: University of Virginia
University of Virginia. News Office--Press coverage
